skillTree.localised_description: Regular consumption of rotten meat and toxins are the staples of a healthy Ogre diet.
As menial slaves to the Butcher's bidding, these Gnoblars must find him meat for the pot, or wind up in it themselves.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve change: +5% when increasing

skillTree.localised_description: More flesh for the feasting means more punishing magic for Skrag's foolish enemies!

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve change: +10% when increasing
Winds of Magic power reserve change: +20% when increasing
Winds of Magic power reserve change: +30% when increasing

skillTree.localised_description: When the Slaughterer goes on the battlefield, only the spray of blood and scattered limbs are left in his wake.
Stumpy and short-witted as they are, these Gnoblars have an eye on the sky at all times.
It never hurts to keep your lucky Gnoblar with you, just in case.
Puny magicks are nothing in the face of the Great Maw's endless hunger.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Once a vision begins takes form, Skrag is relentless in pursuing its path.
Not even the darkest corruption can escape the Maw's devouring influence.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +2 per turn
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Skrag's power allows him to appease the Maw with a smaller tribute from time to time.
Skrag knows the dark caverns under the mountains like the back of his bloated, unwashed hand.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +20%

skillTree.localised_description: When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Bullgorger Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Braingobbler Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Toothcracker Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Bonecrusher Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Once the slaughter begins, every foe is but meat yet to be carved.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Trollguts Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Maw"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Maw Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Maw Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
Where this one goes, his meat-pot goes too, as a bounteous reserve for his spells.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve change: +15% when increasing

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When an Ogre charges, the ground itself begins to quake. As it should.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +8 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Though their intelligence is as pitiful as their physique, one would be a fool not to fear the Gnoblars when massed in numbers.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Gnoblars units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Gnoblars units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Gnoblars units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: If there's one thing more horrifying than being rushed by a hulking, bloodthirsty beast, it's being rushed by that same creature riding on the back of another equally hulking, bloodthirsty beast.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +4% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +8% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Ogres' true firepower is as destructive and indelicate as the Ogres themselves.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +3% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +12% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblaster units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +5% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units

	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +7% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even ferocious brutes like the Ironguts and Maneaters fight harder in the presence of a worthy leader.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Ironguts and Maneaters units

Melee attack: +6 for Ironguts and Maneaters units

Melee defence: +8 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: What the monstrous creatures of the mountains lack in guile, they more than make up for in their stubborn reluctance to die.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +4 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorns, Gorgers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +9 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorn, Gorgers, and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +8 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorns, Gorgers and Giant units

	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Sabretusk Pack, Stonehorns, Gorgers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the most brutal, vicious killer go the richest spoils.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Ironguts, Gnoblars, and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Ironguts, Gnoblars and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Ironguts, Gnoblars and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When pelting a helpless enemy with heavy projectiles is so much fun, why bother stopping?

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +15% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When fearsome, brute strength is combined with terrifying speed, the petty weaklings among the enemy can only wet themselves in fear.

effects.description:
Leadership: +4 for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +7 for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Driven by ravenous hunger, the Maneaters feast on the flesh of the fallen.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +7 for Maneaters, Gorgers and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Maneaters, Gorgers and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Maneaters, Gorgers and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
The mysterious powers of the Great Maw can heal even the deepest of wounds.
Ogres flock to this Butcher's camp, eager for the chance to witness the Great Maw's malevolent power.
This ravening Ogre Lord is but a mere symbol of his god, whose cancerous power reigns over the Mountains of Mourn.
The grumblings of unrest tend to quiet when under threat of being crushed and eaten.
Through a bloody haze of visions, the Butcher sees a great many terrible wonders.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Flesh, limbs, blood and bone – it all goes into the meat-pot!
Wealth is much easier to come by when the omens are guiding your path.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

factionEffects.localised_description: Dragging his massive meat-pot behind him, Skrag the Slaughterer hacks and rips at his enemies in a glorious blood-fuelled dedication to the Great Maw.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -15% during siege battles

items.colour_text: Skrag's cauldron has become a tool by which the former Slaughtermaster makes blessed offerings to his ravenous god.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Cauldron of the Great Maw"

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "It’s all 'ere, in ma pot. Just scamper over and jump in!"

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +8% for Gorgers units
	(Lord's army)
